excerpt: Tofino is a small district on Vancouver Island, off Canada's west coast. It sprawls on a peninsula within Clayoquot Sound, characterised by wild natural scenery including lakes, inlets and ancient rainforest. Sandy beaches with year-round surfing facilities include Cox Bay, Chesterman Beach and popular Long Beach, part of the Pacific Rim National Park Reserve. The relaxed town of Tofino sits on the peninsula's tip.
detail_description: Tofino, a charming district nestled on Vancouver Island's west coast, is a paradise for nature lovers and adventure seekers alike. This picturesque town sits at the tip of a peninsula in Clayoquot Sound, surrounded by breathtaking landscapes featuring ancient rainforests, serene lakes, and stunning inlets. With its sandy beaches like Cox Bay and Long Beach—part of the Pacific Rim National Park Reserve—Tofino is renowned for year-round surfing opportunities that cater to all skill levels.
name: Tofino
address: British Columbia V0R 2Z0, Canada

excerpt: This scenic beach with soft sand & sunset views is a popular surfing destination.
detail_description: Chesterman Beach is a picturesque coastal destination renowned for its soft sand and breathtaking sunsets. This sandy beach boasts a lengthy, magnificent shoreline that curves into a charming heart shape, making it a vibrant spot for families and outdoor enthusiasts in Tofino. Visitors can enjoy the soothing sound of waves while observing the diverse wildlife, including shorebirds, whales, osprey, and otters native to the Pacific West Coast.
name: Chesterman Beach
address: Tofino, BC, Canada

excerpt: This large, sandy beach on a bay is surrounded by trees & is a popular spot for surfing.
detail_description: Cox Bay Beach is a popular spot for surfing and offers a large sandy area surrounded by trees. It is known for its spectacular views, especially during sunset. Visitors can also explore Pettinger Point for panoramic vistas of Cox Bay, Rosie Bay, and Chesterman Beach. The Cedar-shingled Long Beach Lodge Resort provides luxurious accommodation with ocean views and a farm-to-table menu. Additionally, there is a moderate out-and-back trail offering endless views of Cox Bay and the surrounding area.
name: Cox Bay Beach
address: Alberni-Clayoquot, BC, Canada

detail_description: Situated on the serene and picturesque Mackenzie beach in Clayoquot Sound, British Columbia, the BEST WESTERN Tin Wis Resort Lodge provides ideal accommodations. Nature enthusiasts will thrive in this area, as it offers outstanding opportunities for hiking, deep-sea fishing, paddle boarding, surfing, hot springs bathing, canoeing, and kayaking. One can also partake in guided wilderness tours to witness majestic whales and bears.
name: Mackenzie Beach
address: Hellesen Dr, Tofino, BC, Canada

excerpt: Sea-view restaurant with a warm, rustic vibe serving creative locally sourced plates & cocktails.
detail_description: Wolf in the Fog is a charming sea-view eatery with a cozy, rustic atmosphere that offers innovative dishes and cocktails made from locally sourced ingredients. This popular restaurant not only captivates diners with its exquisite food, but also impresses with its stunning decor and ambiance. It is worth noting that Wolf in the Fog caters to families, as it provides a kids menu for younger guests.
name: Wolf in the Fog
address: 150 Fourth St, Tofino, BC V0R 3A0, Canada

detail_description: Tacofino, a renowned food truck in Tofino, gained popularity since its establishment in 2009. Located at the back of the Live To Surf Parking Lot, this vibrant orange truck continues to attract both locals and tourists. Offering an array of mouth-watering tacos, burritos, and gringas (with vegan and vegetarian options available), Tacofino is a must-visit destination. Some menu favorites include the Tuna Ta Taco, Fish Taco, and Krispy Chicken Taco.
name: Tacofino
address: 1184 Pacific Rim Hwy, Tofino, BC V0R 2Z0, Canada

excerpt: High-end oceanfront property offering stylish rooms & cottages, plus dining & a surf school.
detail_description: Long Beach Lodge Resort is a high-end oceanfront property on Vancouver Island's wild and stunning west coast. It offers stylish rooms and cottages with splendid furnishings, including fireplaces and wood accents. The resort pays attention to customers' preferences, providing cozy sitting arrangements that create a homely feeling. Guests can enjoy beautiful views of the ocean waves or watch surfers in Cox Bay while reading a book by the window or in front of the massive fireplace.
name: Long Beach Lodge Resort
address: 1441 Pacific Rim Hwy, Tofino, BC V0R 2Z0, Canada

excerpt: Easygoing spot offering inventive donuts, sandwiches & salads, plus pizza at diner.
detail_description: Rhino Coffee House, a laid-back establishment in Tofino, offers innovative pastries, sandwiches, and salads. They also serve pizza at their diner. Since its opening in 2013, Rhino Coffee has been dedicated to brewing fresh coffee and baking donuts daily. While they provide delivery services for their locally roasted coffee beans across British Columbia, experiencing Rhino's renowned all-day breakfast and homemade wraps requires being present at their physical location.
name: Rhino Coffee House
address: 430 Campbell St, Tofino, BC V0R 2Z0, Canada

excerpt: Contemporary timber house with a patio serving elevated bistro fare sourced from local purveyors.
detail_description: Shelter Restaurant is a modern wooden house with a charming outdoor patio that offers elevated bistro cuisine made from local ingredients. Regardless of the weather in Tofino, this bustling restaurant ensures all your needs are met. Their menu features a variety of dishes ranging from seafood delicacies to more casual options.
name: Shelter Restaurant
address: 634 Campbell St, Tofino, BC V0R 2Z0, Canada

detail_description: Naa'Waya'Sum Gardens, formerly known as the Tofino Botanical Gardens, is a serene and whimsical destination for nature enthusiasts. The 12-acre site offers boardwalked hiking trails through lush greenery and along the shoreline. Visitors can admire an impressive sculpture collection, including pieces with objects washed ashore from the 2011 Japanese tsunami. Guided tours by local experts provide insights into the Indigenous perspective of the surrounding forest.
name: Naa'Waya'Sum Gardens (formerly the Tofino Botanical Gardens)
address: 1084 Pacific Rim Hwy, Tofino, BC V0R 2Z0, Canada

excerpt: Warm, relaxed stop serving burgers, healthy bowls & brews plus year-round patio seating & take-out.
detail_description: The Shed is a welcoming and relaxed eatery in Tofino, Canada that specializes in serving nourishing bowls, beverages, and unique burgers. It boasts a pleasant outdoor seating area that remains available all year round. This highly regarded restaurant prioritizes sustainability by sourcing its beef, chicken, and pork from local farms on Vancouver Island and throughout British Columbia. Situated in downtown Tofino, The Shed provides a warm West Coast ambiance while offering superb dining options for families and friends alike.
name: Shed
address: 461 Campbell St, Tofino, BC V0R 2Z0, Canada

detail_description: The Roy Henry Vickers Gallery is a must-visit for art enthusiasts and history lovers alike. This traditional Northwest Coast longhouse, adorned with intricate carvings and totem poles, showcases the vibrant and evocative artwork of renowned First Nations artist Roy Henry Vickers. Visitors can explore his distinctive pieces inspired by the Pacific Northwest Coast, reflecting Indigenous culture and spirituality.
name: Roy Henry Vickers Gallery
address: 350 Campbell St, Tofino, BC V0R 2Z0, Canada

excerpt: This funky, locally-sourced-seafood shack with minimal seating is popular for its fish ’n’ chips.
detail_description: Wildside Grill is a popular spot in Tofino, known for its locally sourced seafood and burgers. Despite its small size and outdoor-only seating, the shack offers a diverse menu, including breakfast tacos, huevos rancheros, oysters, and free-range chicken burgers. The owners are also set to open Surfside Grill at the nearby Pacific Sands Beach Resort. This new concept will feature dishes like seafood gumbo, prawn burgers, and oysters.
name: Wildside Grill
address: 1180 BC-4, Tofino, BC V0R 3A0, Canada

excerpt: Inventive homemade chocolates & gelato are sold in this quaint, shacklike shop with outdoor seats.
detail_description: Chocolate Tofino is a charming and rustic shop that offers unique homemade chocolates and gelato. It is renowned for its delectable desserts, particularly the handcrafted chocolates with their exquisite designs and flavors. What sets this chocolatier apart is its commitment to using sustainable cocoa in all its products. The owners, Kim and Cam Shaw, take great pride in sourcing the best ingredients available to create their treats.
name: Chocolate Tofino
address: 1180A Pacific Rim Hwy, Tofino, BC V0R 2Z0, Canada

detail_description: Caravan Beach Shop in Tofino is a small, charming store with a great selection of items including clothes, local photographers' prints, and unique camping equipment. The shop is known for its personal service and friendly atmosphere, offering a range of products from coffee cups to art and warm coats. Visitors appreciate the store's accommodating return policy and often leave with something special like overalls, candles, or locally made dog accessories.
name: Caravan Beach Shop
address: 346 Campbell St, Tofino, BC V0R 3A0, Canada

excerpt: Straightforward quarters, a diner & a marina in a vibrant resort set along the coastline.
detail_description: The Tofino Resort + Marina is a vibrant and lively resort located along the coastline, offering straightforward accommodations. The hotel seamlessly combines the rich traditions and artwork of the Tla-o-qui-aht First Nation with modern culinary creativity found in restaurants like 1909 Kitchen and Wolf in the Fog. This destination is perfect for outdoor enthusiasts, as it offers activities such as fishing, hiking, surfing, and stand-up paddleboarding.
name: Tofino Resort + Marina
address: 634 Campbell St, Tofino, BC V0R 2Z0, Canada

excerpt: Celebrated seafood spot with a relaxed setting & a menu highlighting local, seasonal ingredients.
detail_description: SoBo Restaurant is a renowned seafood spot known for its relaxed setting and menu featuring local, seasonal ingredients. It gained popularity as one of Canada's best-known eateries, starting as a small purple food truck. The restaurant offers crispy rock shrimp, cod, and halibut sourced directly from the ocean. Additionally, it houses Tacofino, which has become a destination in itself with food trucks in Vancouver, Victoria, and Kelowna.
name: SoBo Restaurant
address: 311 Neill St, Tofino, BC V0R 3A0, Canada

detail_description: During a recent trip to Tofino, I stumbled upon Merge, a charming store that showcases an array of Canadian-made products including clothing, home decorations, and self-care items. The shop's vibrant pink exterior is truly eye-catching and definitely worth a visit. Merge offers a delightful selection of unique trinkets and gift ideas, albeit with slightly higher price points. However, the quality of the merchandise is exceptional.
name: Merge
address: Pink building in the alley, 305-B Campbell St, Tofino, BC V0R 2Z0, Canada

excerpt: Elegant oceanfront lodging with balconies & fireplaces, plus an elegant restaurant/bar & a spa.
detail_description: The Wickaninnish Inn, a renowned lodge in Tofino, has been providing a luxurious coastal wilderness experience since 1996. The 72 elegant accommodations offer various options, from cozy standard rooms with fireplaces and private balconies showcasing breathtaking ocean views to larger suites with extra living space and bigger balconies. Its magnificent location on Vancouver Island's rugged west coast is surrounded by the Pacific Ocean on three sides and backed by an ancient forest.
name: Wickaninnish Inn
address: 500 Osprey Ln, Tofino, BC V0R 2Z0, Canada

name: Pacific Surf School
address: 441 Campbell St, Tofino, BC V0R 3A0, Canada
